intro: Raphiocarpus aureus, commonly known as the golden flame tree, is a tropical flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It is characterized by its striking yellow-orange flowers that bloom in dense clusters, creating a vibrant display during the flowering season. The plant has compound leaves with elongated leaflets and produces small, round fruits that contain several seeds. It thrives in warm, humid climates and is often cultivated for its ornamental value. Raphiocarpus aureus is a member of the Bignoniaceae family, which includes other showy flowering plants.
